channel.description: This guide will serve as a home base for the Red Hat Developer story, messaging, and visual brand language. It’s a place you can always return to when you have questions about how to best represent Red Hat Developer through messaging or visual elements.

item.title: About
item.description: About the Red Hat Developer Design Manual

item.title: All Products Listing
item.description: This assembly contains all products in a list format that are linked to their overview page. Ability to add a title and description to the assembly. All of the products should be automatically curated in this assembly as long as they exist as a product in drupal.

item.title: Assemblies
item.description: This is an example page of the available Assemblies.

item.title: Blog Posts
item.description: This assembly lists all blog posts in relation to one or many category filters and audiences.

item.title: Bonus Content List
item.description: This assembly allows for one or many pieces of bonus content to be added. Types include docker image, GitHub code, GitLab katacoda, podcast, quay image, and SAAS demo. Links are added to each with the full URL and link text.

item.title: Button CTAs
item.description: Sample variations of the Button CTAs.

item.title: Call to action
item.description: This assembly allows for a title, content and CTA to be added to a full-page banner. A background image can be added. The title is only styled if it is inserted in the “title” field.

item.title: Code snippet
item.description: This assembly allows for code to be added and styled on the page. A programming language can be selected that will properly highlight the syntax (if the plugin doesn’t appear to be working without the language selection).

item.title: Code Snippets
item.description: Various code snippet examples for the Design Manual site.

item.title: Collection
item.description:
With this assembly, the content creator can provide an assembly title, then selects purpose attributes of their choice from a defined list of terms, and lastly must select how many items should display (pagination is also available as an opt-in feature).
Drupal will find content (articles, blogs, videos, etc.) tagged with those selected purpose attributes and display those items as cards in a grid layout.

item.title: Combo
item.description: This assembly allows for up to three types of assemblies to be combined. A WYSIWYG is available for customized content and the additional assemblies can be added as manual items or assembly items. There is a lot of flexibility with it.

item.title: Components Overview
item.description: This is the Components page. It contains examples for all of the components that are used on developers.redhat.com.

item.title: Contact
item.description: The contact form on this page uses [Netlify Forms](https://www.netlify.com/docs/form-handling/) to process submissions, and saves them in your Netlify account where you can optionally set up notifications. Each submission is passed through a spam filter and if flagged, will display a CAPTCHA challenge to the user.

item.title: Content call to action
item.description: This assembly inserts an Eloqua form into the page that acts as a newsletter signup. Users must enter their first and last names and their email address. A WYSIWYG is available as well to add content above the Eloqua form if necessary. This form acts as an inline sign-up.

item.title: Content image
item.description: This assembly inserts an image into the page in the largest format it can cover (depending on the type of content). A caption can be added in addition.

item.title: Featured Quote
item.description: The 'Featured Quote' is one of the funky things that can be achieved in the WSISYG editor for an article **or** by using the 'Featured Quote' assembly itself.

item.title: Content
item.description: This assembly allows for customization of content with a WYSIWYG.

item.title: Create Overview
item.description: This is the Create Overview page.

item.title: CTA form
item.description: This assembly inserts an Eloqua form into the page that acts as a developers program signup. Users must enter their first and last names and their work email address. A title field and a WYSIWYG is available as well to add content above the Eloqua form if necessary. This form is not inline with content.

item.title: Curated content
item.description:
The 'Curated Content' assembly is a flexible and easy way to render links in a card format with an image and title (with option to make that title linkable). You can display the following with this assembly:
**Title (optional)**
**Cards (required)**\ - Static item: add an image of your own choice, provide a title for the card, and make that title linkable if you'd like\ - Node reference: type in the name of a piece of content that already exists, and Drupal will format the title, image, and link accordingly
**Button linking out to whatever you'd like (optional)**

item.title: Curated links
item.description: The curated links assembly can be used as a way to manually select content to be linked off from on a page (as opposed to a collection assembly automatically bringing links in based on a keyword).

item.title: Curated products
item.description: This assembly inserts a group of curated product cards on the page. Products are inputted through node references. A CTA can be added below the grouping. A title can be added above the grouping.

item.title: Develop Overview
item.description: This is the Develop Overview page.

item.title: Dynamic content list
item.description: This assembly lists all content based on inputted WordPress categories, filters, and Drupal term filters. Related topics can also be added here as links below a sidebar of latest comments that appeared on the pieces of content listed. A CTA can be added below the listed content as well.

item.title: Dynamic content
item.description: This assembly lists a desired number of pieces of content in one grouping based on inputted WordPress categories, filters, and Drupal term filters. A title can be added above the grouping.

item.title: Eloqua form embed
item.description: This assembly inserts an Eloqua form within the page. JSON can be customized as well as the CTA link. No other fields are available - this should be used as an assembly reference for CTA form and Content call to action assemblies.

item.title: Embedded content
item.description: This assembly inserts and I frame into the page based on an inputted external URL.

item.title: Events hero
item.description: This assembly allows for events to be showcased within a full-width banner. A primary event will appear on the left with a primary CTA and secondary events will appear to the right of that. Each secondary event comes with a secondary CTA. A sidebar link may also be added and the background image can be changed if necessary.

item.title: Events list
item.description: This assembly allows for events to be listed on a page. Each event is inputted using a node reference. A CTA link can be inserted below the events list.

item.title: Expandable product groups
item.description: This assembly includes all products listed in expandable groups. The only customizable fields include the title and CTA.

item.title: Featured articles
item.description: This assembly inserts cards in a grid to feature articles. It will pull information from the article node references.

item.title: Featured evangelists
item.description: This assembly features authors, pulling from author nodes. The information displayed by each author includes their photo, name, short bio, and social networks. A CTA may be added.

item.title: Featured resources
item.description: This assembly features eBooks, cheat sheets, coding resources and learning guides. Each will contain information from their node reference that will auto-populate the card. A title can be added above the content. CTAs can be added as well.

item.title: Overview of RHD Program goals
item.description: The Red Hat Developer Desing Manual getting started guide is based off of the PatternFly Getting Started guide.

item.title: Home
item.description: This is an example Home page.

item.title: Image hero
item.description: This assembly allows for a background image to be inserted as a hero and content to be customized in a WYSIWYG to be placed over the image.

item.title: Design Manual
item.description: This guide will serve as a home base for the Red Hat Developer story, messaging, and visual brand language. It’s a place you can always return to when you have questions about how to best represent Red Hat Developer through messaging or visual elements.

item.title: Katacoda
item.description: This is an example of the Katacoda page.

item.title: Katacoda
item.description: This is an example of the Katacoda page.

item.title: Katacodas
item.description: This assembly features both katacoda courses and lessons in a card format. Each is referenced through the katacoda node. A title can be added above the collection.

item.title: Layouts
item.description: Examples of various layouts available on CodePen.io

item.title: Learning guides
item.description: This assembly features learning guides as cards that link to the full learning guide connection. A title and description can be added above the cards and a CTA may be added below.

item.title: Red Hat Developer Program Social Images
Node reference
item.description: This assembly features a specific node reference and places it on the page.

item.title: Node Author
item.description: This is an example page of the Node Author.

item.title: On page navigation
item.description: This assembly references all navigation titles from other assemblies on the page and lists them out as jump-to links.

item.title: Pages Overview
item.description: This is the Pages overview page. It contains examples for all of the pages that are used on developers.redhat.com.

item.title: Product hero download
item.description: This assembly allows for a title and content to be customized using a WYSIWYG. A learn more link can be added if needed. An image can be added to the hero. A background image can be added to the hero as well if overriding is necessary. The most recent version will appear under the download CTA by referencing download manager.

item.title: Product download list
item.description: This assembly lists all downloads that come from the download manager for a specific product. It will reference the product node to show downloads.

item.title: Product Try-it hero
item.description: This assembly allows for a title and content to be customized using a WYSIWYG. A learn more link can be added if needed. An image can be added to the hero. A background image can be added to the hero as well if overriding is necessary. The CTA for the try-it link can be customized with a URL and link text.

item.title: Product
item.description: This is an example of a Product page.

item.title: Design resources
item.description: Design content for the Red Hat Developer site using Sketch templates and libraries.

item.title: Rich text columns
item.description: This assembly inserts columns of content onto the page. Each column includes a WYSIWYG to customize the content and another column can be added by selecting “add another item.” A title and content (with a WYSIWYG) can be added above the columns as well.

item.title: Rich text with image
item.description: This assembly inserts a hero of content (customized using a WYSIWYG) and an image that can be linked to an external URL. A background image or svg can be added. A title can also be added outside the WYSIWYG.

item.title: Rich text
item.description: This assembly allows for full customization with a WYSIWYG.

item.title: Sign-up hero
item.description: This assembly inserts a sign up form that contains a title (recommended title automatically fills this field) and content (can be customized with WYSIWYG) next to content and a title (customized with WYSIWYG). Profile level can be customized out of the following options - (1) basic user (2) full user (3) supportable user (4) bulk invite user (5) SOLP user.

item.title: Static item
item.description: This assembly inserts a static item through an uploaded image, external URL or node reference.

item.title: Topic
item.description: This is an example of the Topic page.

item.title: Typography
item.description: Fonts used by the Red Hat Developer Design Team.

item.title: Red Hat Developer Universal Code Block
Video hero
item.description: This assembly displays one or two featured videos. A title and description (WYSIWYG) can be added to each video. A video is referenced through a video node. The background image can be overridden if necessary.

item.title: Videos
item.description: This assembly displays videos based on inputted tags. A title can be added above the listed videos.

item.title: Wordpress post reference
item.description: This assembly displays a wordpress title by referencing the wordpress post node.
